data: Ordering Restricted to Psychiatrists. Psychiatrist or Physician must be present during the infusion
Please check site-specific policy before ordering this powerplan

INCLUSION CRITERIA: 
Diagnosis of major depressive episodes refractory to other drugs, psychotherapy.

Define Refractory Depression as follows:
Refractory to pharmacologic treatment (at least 3 evidence based treatement trials including augmentation antidepressants – at least 2 of escitalopram, venlafaxine, mirtazapine and sertraline, atypical antipsychotic augmentation, lithium augmentation; if bipolar: quetiapine-XR, lamotrigine and lurasidone) AND
Refractory to evidence-based psychotherapy (e.g., Cognitive Behavioral Therapy)

EXCLUSION CRITERIA: 
- Hypersensitivity to ketamine
- Presence of active psychotic symptoms
- Active substance abuse/dependence
- Diagnosis of dementia/delirium
- Presence of significant personality disorder
- Pregnant
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Unstable medical condition(s)
Provider to assess patient prior to discharge
Inform patient of driving restriction post infusion
q15min, during infusion and for 1 hour after completion
q15min, with vital signs, during infusion and for 1 hour after completion
Monitor at all times, during infusion and for 1 hour after completion
q15min, assess for dysphoric behavioral symptoms (sedation, illusions, unpleasant dreams, depersonalization, hallucinations)
Except for Medications, May have ice chips before and after infusion
